version2.prototype.util

Class FileSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • version2.prototype.util.FileSystem

  • public final class FileSystem
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles getting and creating all directories used by the program, creating files, and deleting files. Names are also used in a SQL compliant database. So, all names are standardized to be valid identifiers for it.
    Author:
    michael.devos

      • DescribeNamingRules

        Project naming rules to be displayed to users.

      • GetDownloadDirectory

        public static java.lang.String GetDownloadDirectory(java.lang.String workingDir,
                                                    java.lang.String dataName)
        Gets the download directory path for the given type of data downloaded.
        Parameters:
        workingDir - - path of the working directory for EASTWeb data
        dataName - - name of the data type as defined by global downloaders (e.g. MODIS, NLDAS, etc.)
        Returns:
        path to the download directory for the data

      • GetProcessDirectoryPath

        public static java.lang.String GetProcessDirectoryPath(java.lang.String workingDir,
                                                       java.lang.String projectName,
                                                       java.lang.String pluginName,
                                                       ProcessName processName)
        Gets the process' directory path.
        Parameters:
        workingDir - - path of the working directory for EASTWeb data
        projectName - - name of the project in use
        pluginName - - name of the plugin in use
        processName - - name of the process in use
        Returns:
        path to the process' directory

      • ListNamingRules

        Project naming rules to be displayed to users.
        Returns:

      • StandardizeName

        public static java.lang.String StandardizeName(java.lang.String name)
        Standardizes a given name. Returns what is allowed within the system (safe within PostgreSQL database and on expected major file systems).
        Parameters:
        name - - any identifying name whether it be a directory name or table name to be used
        Returns:
        the given name after cleaning and formatting to be safe to use within the PostgreSQL database and on the file system
